page.title: 03Customs of Twyning Green
page.content: Years ago there was a{fairground} held on the green every{Trinity {Monday,}the children had a day off school to go to the fair. At the fair the{heavy machinery}was pulled by {steam engines}but{horses}pulled the smaller wagons. When the horses wanted to graze they were not allowed on the green, so their owners had to pay 2d per horse to rent a field. All the houses which surround the green face inwards. The reason for this is that the people could keep their animals on the green and keep an eye on them. Many years ago children used it for a{playground.}Now it is used for {fetes, horse riding}and{football matches. The children still use it as a playground though. People also use it as a{picnic area,}or they just sit on the benches and admire the view.
